jcr:content.jcr:title: Edward Jenner Institute for Vaccine Research

contentheadline.headline: Edward Jenner Institute for Vaccine Research

contentrichtext.text: The '''Edward Jenner Institute for Vaccine Research''' was an independent research institute named after [[Edward Jenner]], the inventor of [[vaccination]]. It was co-located with the Compton Laboratory of the [[Institute for Animal Health]] on a campus in the [[England|English]] village of [[Compton, Berkshire|Compton]]. After occupying temporary laboratory space at the Institute for Animal Health from 1996, the Institute moved to a newly completed laboratory building in 1998. Funding of the Institute continued until October 2005 when it was closed. A successor institute, formed by a partnership between the University of Oxford and the UK Institute for Animal Health, was established in November 2005. This Jenner Institute is headquartered in Oxford and supported by a specific charity, the Jenner Vaccine Foundation. == External links == *[http://www.jenner.ac.uk/ Website of the Jenner Institute] {{DEFAULTSORT:Edward Jenner Institute For Vaccine Research}} [[Category:Organisations based in Berkshire]] {{med-org-stub}} *[http://cpd.conted.ox.ac.uk/vaccinology/default.asp Oxford University / Edward Jenner Institute Vaccinology Courses] [[Category:Organisations based in Oxfordshire]] {{med-org-stub}}
